about the author mirto McDonald bein MC
pH D D D born June 21st 1887 at Kenmore
Scotland as a young lad he had a very
moving spiritual experience of seeing
the Christ features and found afterwards
he could see and hear what others
normally did not he learned more about
his gifts when he grew up in education
he entered the medical field for a time
and married in 1913 and had two sons
were born of the Union at the outset of
World War one in 1914 he joined the
Highland light infantry and being a
champion Piper he was made of pipe major
he relinquished his military commission
in 1920 retaining the rank of lieutenant
was honored with the British war medal
Victory Medal and Military Cross in the
1920 he toured many countries lecturing
and healing and by early 1930 he found
the College of Universal Science in
Manchester England at a sands in
Edinburgh MacDonald Bain was told to go
to South Africa from there he was
directed to Indian Tibet where he
studied under living Tibetan masters
where he received the true enlightenment
essential for the writing of the higher
power you can use and I am the life also
author of divine healing of mind and
body in 1944 he began a Center in South
Africa the sanctuary the silent healing
power and continued his lectures twice
weekly many of these were preserved on
wire recordings are now available on CD
he gave two last memorable lectures at
Caxton Hall England and unexpectedly
passed away a few days later on February
26 1955 in England his writings that is
now still have a powerful inspirational
and hidden influence on those who truly

endurance be a finished product so that
you may be finished and complete with
never a defect if you can grasp this
great lesson on faith it is that
starting point through which all shall
be revealed to you as you unfold and the
oneness of life and love making love the
dominant factor in your Deen life read
Paul's epistle the 1st Corinthians
chapter 13 Moffitt's translation which
proves through divine reasoning that the
perfect expression of God through us is
obtained through making love the
dominant factor in our life thus we
become aware of our oneness with God and
also discern our thought action where
and how it is moving
thus we separate the real from the
shadow we do not have to overcome but to
transcend and free our thoughts from
limitations and illusions and in a very
center of our being we find wholeness
completeness this is the freedom of
truth end of part 1
